headline: Tesla, Palantir, Beyond Meat: Trending stocks
summary: One of Tesla's (TSLA) largest shareholders says it will vote against Elon Musk's trillion-dollar pay package. Palantir (PLTR) shares fall despite earnings beat, and AMD is down ahead of its financial results today. Following a rally yesterday, IREN and other infrastructure companies (CIFR, LUMN, AMKR) are deep in the red in pre-market. Beyond Meat (BYND) also nosedives after delaying reporting earnings. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Uber Earnings Crush Estimates. Why the Stock Is Getting Slammed.
summary: Uber Technologies  stock fell sharply Tuesday after the ride-hailing company’s third-quarter earnings beat expectations, in large part due to one-time tax and investment benefits.  Gross bookings of $49.7 billion also surpassed forecasts for $49 billion, with better-than-expected results across both ride-hailing and Uber Eats.  The massive earnings beat was down to a $4.9 billion benefit from a tax valuation release and a $1.5 billion pretax benefit from revaluations of the company’s equity investments.

content.title: Uber Earnings Crush Estimates. Why the Stock Is Getting Slammed.
content.summary: Uber Technologies  stock fell sharply Tuesday after the ride-hailing company’s third-quarter earnings beat expectations, in large part due to one-time tax and investment benefits.  Gross bookings of $49.7 billion also surpassed forecasts for $49 billion, with better-than-expected results across both ride-hailing and Uber Eats.  The massive earnings beat was down to a $4.9 billion benefit from a tax valuation release and a $1.5 billion pretax benefit from revaluations of the company’s equity investments.

headline: Norway wealth fund to oppose Musk's $1 trillion Tesla pay deal
summary: OSLO (Reuters) -Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, said on Tuesday it would vote against ratifying Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed compensation package that is potentially worth $1 trillion at an annual general meeting later this week. Investors in the electric-vehicle maker will decide on November 6 whether to approve the package, likely the largest-ever CEO compensation agreement.

content.title: Norway wealth fund to oppose Musk's $1 trillion Tesla pay deal
content.summary: OSLO (Reuters) -Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, said on Tuesday it would vote against ratifying Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed compensation package that is potentially worth $1 trillion at an annual general meeting later this week. Investors in the electric-vehicle maker will decide on November 6 whether to approve the package, likely the largest-ever CEO compensation agreement.

headline: Big Tesla investor will vote against Musk's massive pay package
summary: There will be more than a dozen company proposals up for a vote Thursday during Tesla's annual meeting, but none have generated more division than Musk's potentially massive pay package.  “While we appreciate the significant value created under Mr. Musk’s visionary role, we are concerned about the total size of the award, dilution, and lack of mitigation of key person risk consistent with our views on executive compensation,” said Norges Bank Investment Management, which manages the country’s Government Pension Fund Global.

content.title: Big Tesla investor will vote against Musk's massive pay package
content.summary: There will be more than a dozen company proposals up for a vote Thursday during Tesla's annual meeting, but none have generated more division than Musk's potentially massive pay package.  “While we appreciate the significant value created under Mr. Musk’s visionary role, we are concerned about the total size of the award, dilution, and lack of mitigation of key person risk consistent with our views on executive compensation,” said Norges Bank Investment Management, which manages the country’s Government Pension Fund Global.

headline: Norway wealth fund to vote against Musk's $1 trillion Tesla package
summary:
STORY: Norway's sovereign wealth fund is the world's largest.

And on Tuesday it said it would vote against approving Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed compensation package, containing shares worth up to $1 trillion.

Investors in the electric-vehicle maker will decide on November 6 whether to confirm the package.

It's thought to be the largest-ever CEO compensation agreement and critics have called it excessive.

So far, the Norwegian wealth fund is the largest outside Tesla investor to say how it plans to vote.

The next-largest to do so, Baron Capital, on Monday said it would support Musk's pay package.

Other major investors like BlackRock, Vanguard and State Street have yet to disclose their voting plans.

Tesla's board is pushing for shareholders to approve the plan.

Its chair warned last week Musk could leave the company if the deal is rejected.

While the package could grant stock worth up to $1 trillion over 10 years, the cost of those shares at the time of the award will be deducted.

According to Reuters analysis, that will make the value to Musk slightly lower, at up to $878 billion,.

The $2.1 trillion Norwegian fund also said it would vote against Tesla's proposed general stock compensation plan.

It's intended for all employees and can also be used by the board to benefit Musk.

content.title: Norway wealth fund to vote against Musk's $1 trillion Tesla package
content.summary:
STORY: Norway's sovereign wealth fund is the world's largest.

And on Tuesday it said it would vote against approving Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed compensation package, containing shares worth up to $1 trillion.

Investors in the electric-vehicle maker will decide on November 6 whether to confirm the package.

It's thought to be the largest-ever CEO compensation agreement and critics have called it excessive.

So far, the Norwegian wealth fund is the largest outside Tesla investor to say how it plans to vote.

The next-largest to do so, Baron Capital, on Monday said it would support Musk's pay package.

Other major investors like BlackRock, Vanguard and State Street have yet to disclose their voting plans.

Tesla's board is pushing for shareholders to approve the plan.

Its chair warned last week Musk could leave the company if the deal is rejected.

While the package could grant stock worth up to $1 trillion over 10 years, the cost of those shares at the time of the award will be deducted.

According to Reuters analysis, that will make the value to Musk slightly lower, at up to $878 billion,.

The $2.1 trillion Norwegian fund also said it would vote against Tesla's proposed general stock compensation plan.

It's intended for all employees and can also be used by the board to benefit Musk.

headline: Tesla's China-made EV sales fall 9.9% y/y in October
summary: Tesla's China-made electric vehicle sales fell 9.9% to 61,497 units in October from a year earlier, reversing a 2.8% increase in September, data from the China Passenger Car Association showed on Tuesday. Sales of the U.S. automaker's Model 3 and Model Y vehicles made at its Shanghai "gigafactory", including exports to Europe, India and other markets, dropped 32.3% from September. Its biggest Chinese rival, BYD, posted a 12% drop in global vehicle sales last month, a second consecutive month of decline and the steepest fall in nearly two years amid hyper-competition in the home market.

content.title: Tesla's China-made EV sales fall 9.9% y/y in October
content.summary: Tesla's China-made electric vehicle sales fell 9.9% to 61,497 units in October from a year earlier, reversing a 2.8% increase in September, data from the China Passenger Car Association showed on Tuesday. Sales of the U.S. automaker's Model 3 and Model Y vehicles made at its Shanghai "gigafactory", including exports to Europe, India and other markets, dropped 32.3% from September. Its biggest Chinese rival, BYD, posted a 12% drop in global vehicle sales last month, a second consecutive month of decline and the steepest fall in nearly two years amid hyper-competition in the home market.

headline: Norwegian opposition complicates Musk's path to $1 trillion pay deal
summary: OSLO / BOSTON (Reuters) -Norway's sovereign wealth fund, Tesla's sixth-largest outside investor, said on Tuesday it would vote against ratifying a proposed pay deal for CEO Elon Musk potentially worth $1 trillion.  Musk's pay package is still seen as likely to win, given broad investor support in the past ​and the backing Tesla enjoys from its large retail shareholder base.  Laws in Texas, where Tesla moved its headquarters last year, allow Musk to vote his own large stake, giving ‌him 15.3% of voting power including restricted stock granted in August.

content.title: Norwegian opposition complicates Musk's path to $1 trillion pay deal
content.summary: OSLO / BOSTON (Reuters) -Norway's sovereign wealth fund, Tesla's sixth-largest outside investor, said on Tuesday it would vote against ratifying a proposed pay deal for CEO Elon Musk potentially worth $1 trillion.  Musk's pay package is still seen as likely to win, given broad investor support in the past ​and the backing Tesla enjoys from its large retail shareholder base.  Laws in Texas, where Tesla moved its headquarters last year, allow Musk to vote his own large stake, giving ‌him 15.3% of voting power including restricted stock granted in August.

headline: Is There Still Opportunity in Tesla After Its 93% Rally This Year?
summary: Wondering if Tesla is still a good buy or if the market might be getting ahead of itself? Let’s break down what’s changed and where value might really lie. Over the past year, Tesla’s stock has skyrocketed nearly 93%. It’s gained 9.0% in the last month and 23.5% year-to-date, highlighting ongoing growth, and perhaps shifting risk perceptions. Recent headlines point to Tesla’s latest moves to ramp up global production and experiment with innovative EV offerings. Analysts and investors have...

headline: Nvidia Partners With $750M Startup Spectro Cloud To Fix AI's Biggest Problem: Companies Waste 70% Of Their GPU Computing Power
summary: Spectro Cloud, a Goldman Sachs–backed (NASDAQ:GS) startup valued at about $750 million, announced on Tuesday that it entered a strategic partnership with Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) to address one of the biggest challenges in artificial intelligence: approximately 70% of computing power that often sits unused. Spectro Cloud unveiled its PaletteAI platform with Nvidia integration, which promises to increase graphics processing unit efficiency from 30% to 60%, potentially saving enterprises millions on i

headline: The Stock Market Is in Risk-Off Mode. These Sectors Are Leading the Pack.
summary: The stock market is going through a true risk-off moment.  With mostly red on the screen, two ETFs outperforming the broader market were both focused on stocks with relatively low volatility.  Instead, the top sectors were financials, health care, and consumer staples.

content.title: The Stock Market Is in Risk-Off Mode. These Sectors Are Leading the Pack.

headline: Norway’s Sovereign Wealth Fund Votes ‘No’ on Musk Pay Plan
summary: Tesla on Thursday will reveal shareholders’ vote on Chief Executive Elon Musk’s new $1 trillion pay package. Norway's sovereign-wealth fund said Tuesday that it has rejected the compensation plan over concerns about its size, becoming the first major investor to disclose its decision.

content.title: Norway’s Sovereign Wealth Fund Votes ‘No’ on Musk Pay Plan
content.summary: Tesla on Thursday will reveal shareholders’ vote on Chief Executive Elon Musk’s new $1 trillion pay package. Norway's sovereign-wealth fund said Tuesday that it has rejected the compensation plan over concerns about its size, becoming the first major investor to disclose its decision.

headline: Tech Stocks Are Behind the S&P’s Swings
summary: Tuesday’s slump highlights how much a handful of megacap tech companies have helped swing markets. The S&P 500 is up 1.7% over the past 10 days, while the Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF, which tracks Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Microsoft, Nvidia and Tesla, has gained 5.

content.title: Tech Stocks Are Behind the S&P’s Swings
